item.title: Blocked drain at corner of Marle Hill Parade/ Marle Hill Road, 13th May
item.description:
The drain at the edge of the road, on the corner of Marle Hill Parade where it joins Marle Hill Road is blocked. Every time we have heavy rain it floods half way across the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 48 Marle Hill Parade, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked footpath in strip of wooded land that runs alongside the slipway southbound onM5 on A417, 13th May
item.description:
I own and maintain the land/footpath at either end of this blocked section of footpath. Recently I’ve been receiving abuse from walkers about this blocked section as they’ve now rerouted through my land and crops and damaged fences in doing so. The footpath should have been kept clear as part of routine maintenance as is your duty of care as land owners, but is now totally overgrown and I’m suffering the consequences! Brockworth is rapidly expanding on just the other side of the A417 and footfall will only increase as a result. Access may be required through my land to rectify the problem. Best regards Will Speakman 07974568144
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 11 BROCKWORTH, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains and flooding on Malvern Place, 13th May
item.description:
Please could you take a look urgently at Malvern Place in Lansdowne, there are blocked drains either side of the road resulting in some significant flooding. Thanks, Tabi

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Douro House Douro Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: What has to be a Fly Tip in the AONB!, 12th May
item.description:
The location is on the Cleeve Common Road at the top of the first hill on the right hand side going towards the common. The tip is just inside a gateway to the wood there. The tip contains metal bed parts, other waste materials as well as a lot of plastic which looks as though it enclosed organic material at one time. As it has now been there for over 1 month and is in full view of visitors to the area - please can action be taken to clear it away.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: What has to be a Fly Tip in the AONB!, 12th May

item.title: Green kerb rapidly disappearing, 12th May
item.description:
Been over 5 years since this road was properly cleaned/cleared. This problem extends into the drains as well. The adjacent nearby footpath is also overgrown with grass making this pavement slippery, and dangerous for residents. Especially those with mobility issues.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 18 Lynworth Place, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothhole, 12th May
item.description:
There is a pothole on the pavement and a big void underneath it,I work in security at Safran and this is next to our red brick security office but on the roadway, I have put traffic cones over to stop anyone hurting themseselves.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Guard House Down Hatherley Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic sign -no right turn not being observed, 11th May
item.description:
Drivers approaching lights are turning right into Hayward’s Road, crossing the traffic flow on London Road (out of town), even though there is a traffic sign (no right turn) . This is very dangerous as there is traffic queuing to bear right into Cirencester Road, together with traffic continuing along the London Road. More signage needed or markings in the road at the junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 175 London Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge potholes, 11th May
item.description:
Huge potholes down the length of the road, so many it's impossible to avoid them when driving, especially with cars parked on both sides. Needs resurfacing ASAP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 22 East Approach Drive, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
